result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Devries was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael W. Devries is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael W. Devries was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.    Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; pay $250 DNA surcharge.  Weapon to be transferred to Atty Kmiec.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 2 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 6/2/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.  Court orders deft to submit DNA sample, Deputy transported deft from court to submit sample.
Deft's motion to dismiss ct 2: filed by Atty T Kmiec.
Demand for Discovery FILED BY  DDA M Graveley

And order for other prosecution costs in the amount of: $86.00 - filed by ADA M Graveley
Order not yet signed by the judge.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney T Kmiec.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Kmiec's motion to suppress.  Witnesses are sequestered.  Testimony taken from:  KSD Deputy Eric Klinkhammer, KSD Deputy Tyrone Johnson.  Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record.  JS set for 4/6/15 at 9am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Kmiec is requesting 7/17/2014 Final pre-trial be rescheduled to allow him time to finish reviewing discovery.  Final pre-trial is rescheduled to 9/11/2014 at 1:30pm.  Parties notified in court.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Ted Kmiec. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 7. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-17-14 @ 10:30am. Bond continued.
